_header: The might of the Father of heaven
Note: For the usual text see 1953 and 5398; for an abridged and altered text see 788.
_description: The East Midland recension of the Pricke of Conscience

Bod423.First Lines:
Quia ad tempus credunt & in tempore temptacionis recedunt .To a
                    tyme he seith sum beleuyth a thyngAnd passith þere fro in time of
                    soundyng…
Bod423.Last Lines:
…To þe whiche blisse god vs alle bryngeThat for oure loue
                    made alle thynge . Amen quod A.
Bod423.Note:
Missing lines 1-312, 1794-1962. At the end ‘Explicit Stimulus
                        Conscientie quod Iohannes Appilton’.
Bod423.Attributed Title: Stimulus Conscientie (on f. 244 in later hand)

BodLauMis601.First Lines:
The miȝt of þe fader off heueneþe wit of þe
                    sone wiþ his ȝiftes seuene…
BodLauMis601.Last Lines:
…To þe which ioye he vs bringeþat for oure loue made
                    al þing
BodLauMis601.Attributed Title:
Heere endeþ þe bok þat is ycleped þe prikke of
                    concience (at the end)

CULEe435b.First Lines:
ÞE miȝt of þe holi fadur In heueneÞe wit of
                    þe sone with his ȝiftus seuene…
CULEe435b.Last Lines:
…Off eni clerk oþer lewede manÞe whiche mi defaute
                    amende kan

CamStJohn29.First Lines:
The myght of the fadir of heuenAnd the wit of the son with his
                    ȝiftes seuen…
CamStJohn29.Last Lines:
…To þe whiche blisse god vs bryngeThat for oure loue made
                    al thynge

BLAdd11305.First Lines:
The myght of the fader in heuenThe witte of the sone wiþ his
                    ȝiftes seuene…
BLAdd11305.Last Lines:
…To the whiche ioy he vs bringeThat for our loue makes all
                    thinge

BLAru140.First Lines:
In þe myght of þe fadyr all myghtyThe wyte of þe
                    sonne all wytty…
BLAru140.Last Lines:
…To þe which he vs all bryngeÞat for our loue made
                    heuen & erþe & all þynge
BLAru140.Note: Missing two leaves between ff. 144 and 145.

BLHar1731.First Lines: …Þan ouȝt a man þat haþ skyle & feyHys creatour to honour By al maner wey…
BLHar1731.Last Lines: …To þe whuch ioye he vs BryngeThat for oure loue made al þynge
BLHar1731.Attributed Title: Here endeþ þe Book þat ys yclepud Prykke of conscience. Explicit tractatus. Willelmus (f. 133v).

BLHar2281.First Lines: The myght of þe fader of heuenþe wyt of þe soone wiþ ȝiftes seuene…
BLHar2281.Last Lines: …He seiþ when y shal take my tyme aryȝtþan wil y deme riȝtfulnes þoruȝ myth[  ]…
BLHar2281.Note: Ends incomplete at line 5765 at end of volume, last extant lines followed by heading, “Hou men shulde ȝeue acountes at þe day of dome of þe seuen werkes of mercy þat hi did noȝt here by hire lyf” and catchword, “et behouet” (f. 64v).

BLHar2377.First Lines: …God made þe world so seyþ holy wrytTo serue man & man not to serue it…
BLHar2377.Last Lines: …He seyþ of wormes þi bed schal beþat schal be strawed þyke vndur þe…
BLHar2377.Note: Missing lines 1-1151 and ends at line 9153.

Lichfield16.First Lines:
The mighte of þe fader al myȝtty[T]he wytte of þe
                    son al wytty…
Lichfield16.Last Lines:
…To þe wuche opye he us bryngeþat for oure loue made
                    al þynge
Lichfield16.Attributed Title:
Here endeþ þe bok þat ys cleped þe pryk of concyens (f.
                        189v)

Lichfield50.First Lines:
The myth of þe fader of heueneThe wyt of þe sone with
                    hese ȝeftes seuene…
Lichfield50.Last Lines:
…And qwo so loue god in a ryt manerHe hat gret dred to wreyin
                    hym her

PULGar138.First Lines:
The myght of þe fader almyȝttyÞe witte of þe
                    sone al wittyAnd þe godenes of þe holi gostAnd god and lord
                    of myȝttes most…
PULGar138.Last Lines:
…To þe whiche place he vs alle bryngÞat for our loue
                    made al thyng

HunHM125.First Lines:
ÞE myȝt of þe fader of heuene Þe witte of
                    þe sone,with hys ȝiftes seuene…
HunHM125.Last Lines:
…To whiche ioye he vs bryngeÞat for oure loue made alle
                    þ[ynge]
HunHM125.Note:
Ends of last ten lines and colophon lost because most of folio 100 cut
                    away; after colophon, ‘ffinem composui pe[ ]te[ ]’ (f.
                    100.
HunHM125.Attributed Title: Here endeþ þe pricke of concie[nce] (f. 100)

HunHM128.First Lines:
The myght of the fadur of heueneThe wyt of the sone wyth hys
                    ȝyftes seuene…
HunHM128.Last Lines:
…To þe which he vs bryngethat for our loue maked all
                    þynge
HunHM128.Attributed Title:
Here bygynneþ þe prologe on the Prikke of consciencie… (f.
                    1); Here endet þe prikke of conscience (f. 94)

HunHM130.First Lines:
…Euer to knowe boþe gode and illeAnd þerto ȝaf
                    him witt at wille…
HunHM130.Last Lines:
…Vnto þat same ioye he vs bringeþat for oure loue
                    makede al þinge
HunHM130.Note:
Begins imperfectly due to missing folio at beginning; lines 1-76
                    missing; to right of ending, ‘Amen par charite’ (f.
                    120v).

TCD69.First Lines:
Þe myȝt of þe fader of heueneþe wit of þe
                    sone with his ȝiftes seuene…
TCD69.Last Lines:
…To þe wich place he vs alle bringeþat for mannus
                    loue made alle þinge
